senses.sense_definition: The branch of philosophy that studies the fundamental nature of reality, including abstract concepts such as being, identity, time, and space.

examples.text: She decided to study <w>metaphysics</w> at the university to explore the nature of existence.
The professor gave a complex lecture on the <w>metaphysics</w> of time and causality.

senses.sense_definition: The study or exploration of spiritual, occult, or supernatural phenomena that transcend the physical world.

examples.text: The local bookstore has a large section dedicated to <w>metaphysics</w>, featuring books on crystals and meditation.
His interest in <w>metaphysics</w> led him to explore various spiritual traditions and practices.

senses.sense_definition: A specific theoretical system or set of principles regarding the nature of reality developed by a particular philosopher.

examples.text: The <w>metaphysics</w> of Aristotle differs significantly from the ideas proposed by Plato.
Scholars have spent centuries analyzing the complex <w>metaphysics</w> of Immanuel Kant.

senses.sense_definition: The underlying fundamental principles, dynamics, or rules governing a specific domain or situation.

examples.text: Understanding the <w>metaphysics</w> of global power requires looking beyond simple geography.
The <w>metaphysics</w> of the modern market have changed with the rise of digital currencies.

senses.sense_definition: Writing or reasoning that is excessively complex, abstract, or difficult to understand.

examples.text: The report was filled with bureaucratic <w>metaphysics</w> that confused everyone in the meeting.
I cannot follow the <w>metaphysics</w> of his argument because it lacks any practical examples.

senses.sense_definition: The logical framework or theoretical basis that underlies the science of physics.

examples.text: Theoretical physicists often discuss the <w>metaphysics</w> required to support their mathematical models.
We must understand the generic <w>metaphysics</w> before we can define the laws of a new universe.
The various <w>metaphysics</w> proposed by different cultures show humanity's shared quest for meaning.
He compared the two distinct <w>metaphysics</w> to see which offered a better explanation of reality.
